Package com.ibm.streams.management.security

Interface PrincipalMXBean

All Known Subinterfaces:
RoleMXBean
public interface PrincipalMXBean
PrincipalMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing Streams user, group, and role principals.

The following methods can be used to build the ObjectName for a PrincipalMXBean.

ObjectNameBuilder.domainPrincipal(String, PrincipalMXBean.Type, String)
ObjectNameBuilder.instancePrincipal(String, String, PrincipalMXBean.Type, String)

    Enumeration for the types of security principles.

    static final String
    USER_OWNER
    USER_OWNER is a reserved user defined by Streams to grant permissions to the owner of a secured object.

  • Field Details

    • IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT

      static final String IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DOMAIN_TYPE

      static final String DOMAIN_TYPE
      DOMAIN_TYPE is used when building the ObjectName for a domain principal bean. The value is "domain.principal"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INSTANCE_TYPE

      static final String INSTANCE_TYPE
      INSTANCE_TYPE is used when building the ObjectName for an instance principal bean. The value is "domain.instance.principal"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • USER_OWNER

      static final String USER_OWNER
      USER_OWNER is a reserved user defined by Streams to grant permissions to the owner of a secured object. The value is "owner"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultPermissions

      Map<String,Permissions> getDefaultPermissions()
      Returns the default permissions used for new child objects set specifically for the principal. This does not include default permissions granted as the result of the principal being a member of a group or role.
      Returns:
      the set of secured objects for which the principal has specific default permissions assigned and the corresponding default permissions for each secured object.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. For more information see the product documentation on security objects.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of the user, group, or role identified by the principal.
      Returns:
      the principal name.

    • getPermissions

      Map<String,Permissions> getPermissions()
      Returns the permissions set specifically for the principal. This does not include permissions granted as the result of the principal being a member of a group or role.
      Returns:
      the set of secured objects for which the principal has specific permissions assigned and the corresponding permissions for each secured object.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • isReserved

      boolean isReserved()
      Indicates whether the principal is defined by Streams.
      Returns:
      the reserved principal indicator.

    • getType

      PrincipalMXBean.Type getType()
      Returns the type of principal.
      Returns:
      the principal type.

    • addPermission

      void addPermission(String securedObject, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionType permissionType, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionScope scope)
      Adds an individual permission to a secured object for the principal.
      Parameters:
      securedObject - identifies the secured object to which permission is added.
      permissionType - specifies the type of permission to add.
      scope - specifies the scope of the added permission.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if securedObject, permissionType or scope is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getPermissions

      Permissions getPermissions(String securedObject, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionScope scope)
      Returns the permissions set for the principal, at a specified scope, to a secured object. This does not include permissions granted as the result of the principal being a member of a group or role.
      Parameters:
      securedObject - identifies the secured object for which permissions are requested.
      scope - specifies the scope of the permissions to return.
      Returns:
      the object permissions.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if securedObject or scope is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • hasPermission

      boolean hasPermission(String securedObject, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionType permissionType, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionScope scope)
      Indicates whether the principal has a specified permission, at a specified scope, to a secured object.
      Parameters:
      securedObject - identifies the secured object for which the permission is checked.
      permissionType - specifies the permission type to check.
      scope - specifies the scope of the permission to check.
      Returns:
      true if the principal has the permission at the specified scope.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if securedObject, permissionType or scope is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • removePermission

      void removePermission(String securedObject, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionType permissionType, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionScope scope)
      Removes a specified permission, at a specified scope, for the principal to a secured object.
      Parameters:
      securedObject - identifies the secured object for which permission is being removed.
      permissionType - specifies the type of permission to remove.
      scope - specifies the scope of the permission to remove.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if securedObject, permissionType or scope is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • setPermissions

      void setPermissions(String securedObject, Permissions permissions, SecuredObjectManagerMXBean.PermissionScope scope)
      Sets permissions for the principal, at a specified scope, to a secured object.
      Parameters:
      securedObject - identifies the secured object for which the permissions are set.
      permissions - specifies the permissions to set.
      scope - specifies the scope of the permissions to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if securedObject, permissions or scope is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
